name: acpi_tables
description: Firmware ACPI functional table common metadata and content.

name: ad_config
description: OS X Active Directory configuration.

name: alf

columns.name: allow_signed_enabled
columns.description: 1 If allow signed mode is enabled else 0

columns.name: global_state
columns.description: 1 If the firewall start by default else 0

columns.name: logging_enabled
columns.description: 1 If logging mode is enabled else 0

columns.name: stealth_enabled
columns.description: 1 If stealth mode is enabled else 0

description: OS X application layer firewall (ALF) service details.

name: alf_exceptions

columns.name: path
columns.description: Path to the executable that is excepted

description: OS X application layer firewall (ALF) service exceptions.

name: alf_explicit_auths
description: ALF services explicitly allowed to perform networking.

name: alf_services
description: OS X application layer firewall (Firewall) services.

name: app_schemes

columns.name: enabled
columns.description: 1 if this handler is the OS default, else 0

columns.name: external
columns.description: 1 if this handler does NOT exist on OS X by default, else 0

columns.name: protected
columns.description: 1 if this handler is protected (reserved) by OS X, else 0

description: OS X application schemes and handlers (e.g., http, file, mailto).

name: appcompat_shims

columns.name: executable
columns.description: Name of the executable that is being shimmed. This is pulled from the registry.

columns.name: path
columns.description: This is the path to the SDB database.

description: Application Compatibility shims are a way to persist malware. This table presents the AppCompat Shim information from the registry in a nice format. See http://files.brucon.org/2015/Tomczak_and_Ballenthin_Shims_for_the_Win.pdf for more details.

name: apps

columns.name: element
columns.description: Does the app identify as a background agent

columns.name: minimum_system_version
columns.description: Minimum version of OS X required for the app to run

columns.name: category
columns.description: The UTI that categorizes the app for the App Store

columns.name: last_opened_time
columns.description: The time that the app was last used

description: OS X applications installed in known search paths (e.g., /Applications).

name: apt_sources
description: Current list of APT repositories or software channels.

name: arp_cache

columns.name: interface
columns.description: Interface of the network for the MAC

description: Address resolution cache, both static and dynamic (from ARP, NDP).

name: asl

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Sender's identification string.  Default is process name.

columns.name: pid
columns.description: Sending process ID encoded as a string.  Set automatically.

columns.name: gid
columns.description: GID that sent the log message (set by the server).

columns.name: uid
columns.description: UID that sent the log message (set by the server).

columns.name: level
columns.description: Log level number.  See levels in asl.h.

columns.name: ref_pid
columns.description: Reference PID for messages proxied by launchd

columns.name: ref_proc
columns.description: Reference process for messages proxied by launchd

columns.name: extra
columns.description: Extra columns, in JSON format. Queries against this column are performed entirely in SQLite, so do not benefit from efficient querying via asl.h.

description: Queries the Apple System Log data structure for system events.

name: augeas

columns.name: node
columns.description: The node path of the configuration item

columns.name: value
columns.description: The value of the configuration item

columns.name: label
columns.description: The label of the configuration item

columns.name: path
columns.description: The path to the configuration file

description: Configuration files parsed by augeas.

name: authenticode

columns.name: path
columns.description: Must provide a path or directory

columns.name: original_program_name

description: File (executable, bundle, installer, disk) code signing status.

columns.name: privileged

description: OS X Authorization mechanisms database.

name: authorizations

columns.description: Item name, usually in reverse domain format

description: OS X Authorization rights database.

name: autoexec

description: Aggregate of executables that will automatically execute on the target machine. This is an amalgamation of other tables like services, scheduled tasks, startup_items and more.

columns.name: event_queue

name: virtual_memory_info

columns.name: wired
columns.description: Total number of wired down pages.

columns.name: faults
columns.description: Total number of calls to vm_faults.

columns.name: zero_fill
columns.description: Total number of zero filled pages.

columns.name: file_backed
columns.description: Total number of file backed pages.

columns.name: compressor
columns.description: The number of pages used to store compressed VM pages.

columns.name: decompressed
columns.description: The total number of pages that have been decompressed by the VM compressor.

columns.name: compressed
columns.description: The total number of pages that have been compressed by the VM compressor.

columns.name: page_ins
columns.description: The total number of requests for pages from a pager.

columns.name: page_outs
columns.description: Total number of pages paged out.

columns.name: swap_ins
columns.description: The total number of compressed pages that have been swapped out to disk.

columns.name: swap_outs
columns.description: The total number of compressed pages that have been swapped back in from disk.

description: Darwin Virtual Memory statistics.

name: wifi_networks

columns.name: security_type
columns.description: Type of security on this network

columns.name: last_connected
columns.description: Last time this netword was connected to as a unix_time

columns.name: possibly_hidden
columns.description: 1 if network is possibly a hidden network, 0 otherwise

columns.name: roaming_profile
columns.description: Describe the roaming profile, usually one of Single, Dual  or Multi

columns.name: captive_portal
columns.description: 1 if this network has a captive portal, 0 otherwise

columns.name: auto_login
columns.description: 1 if auto login is enabled, 0 otherwise

columns.name: temporarily_disabled
columns.description: 1 if this network is temporarily disabled, 0 otherwise

columns.name: disabled
columns.description: 1 if this network is disabled, 0 otherwise

description: OS X known/remembered Wi-Fi networks list.

name: wifi_status

columns.name: bssid
columns.description: The current basic service set identifier

columns.name: country_code
columns.description: The country code (ISO/IEC 3166-1:1997) for the network

columns.name: security_type
columns.description: Type of security on this network

columns.name: rssi
columns.description: The current received signal strength indication (dbm)

columns.name: mode
columns.description: The current operating mode for the Wi-Fi interface

description: OS X current WiFi status.

name: wifi_survey

columns.name: bssid
columns.description: The current basic service set identifier

columns.name: country_code
columns.description: The country code (ISO/IEC 3166-1:1997) for the network

columns.name: rssi
columns.description: The current received signal strength indication (dbm)

description: Scan for nearby WiFi networks.

name: windows_crashes

columns.name: module
columns.description: Path of the crashed module within the process

columns.name: path
columns.description: Path of the executable file for the crashed process

columns.name: pid
columns.description: Process ID of the crashed process

columns.name: tid
columns.description: Thread ID of the crashed thread

columns.name: version
columns.description: File version info of the crashed process

columns.name: process_uptime
columns.description: Uptime of the process in seconds

columns.name: stack_trace
columns.description: Multiple stack frames from the stack trace

columns.name: exception_message
columns.description: The NTSTATUS error message associated with the exception code

columns.name: exception_address
columns.description: Address (in hex) where the exception occurred

columns.name: registers
columns.description: The values of the system registers

columns.name: command_line
columns.description: Command-line string passed to the crashed process

columns.name: current_directory
columns.description: Current working directory of the crashed process

columns.name: username
columns.description: Username of the user who ran the crashed process

columns.name: machine_name
columns.description: Name of the machine where the crash happened

columns.name: major_version
columns.description: Windows major version of the machine

columns.name: minor_version
columns.description: Windows minor version of the machine

columns.name: build_number
columns.description: Windows build number of the crashing machine

description: Extracted information from Windows crash logs (Minidumps).

name: windows_events

columns.name: datetime
columns.description: System time at which the event occurred

columns.name: source
columns.description: Source or channel of the event

columns.name: task
columns.description: Task value associated with the event

columns.name: level
columns.description: The severity level associated with the event

columns.name: keywords
columns.description: A bitmask of the keywords defined in the event

description: Windows Event logs.

name: wmi_cli_event_consumers

columns.name: command_line_template
columns.description: Standard string template that specifies the process to be started. This property can be NULL, and the ExecutablePath property is used as the command line.

columns.name: executable_path
columns.description: Module to execute. The string can specify the full path and file name of the module to execute, or it can specify a partial name. If a partial name is specified, the current drive and current directory are assumed.

columns.name: relative_path
columns.description: Relative path to the class or instance.

description: WMI CommandLineEventConsumer, which can be used for persistance on Windows. See https://www.blackhat.com/docs/us-15/materials/us-15-Graeber-Abusing-Windows-Management-Instrumentation-WMI-To-Build-A-Persistent%20Asynchronous-And-Fileless-Backdoor-wp.pdf for more details.

name: wmi_event_filters

columns.name: name
columns.description: Unique identifier of an event filter.

columns.name: query
columns.description: Windows Management Instrumentation Query Language (WQL) event query that specifies the set of events for consumer notification, and the specific conditions for notification.

columns.name: query_language
columns.description: Query language that the query is written in.

columns.name: relative_path
columns.description: Relative path to the class or instance.

description: Lists WMI event filters.

name: wmi_filter_consumer_binding

columns.name: consumer
columns.description: Reference to an instance of __EventConsumer that represents the object path to a logical consumer, the recipient of an event.

columns.name: filter
columns.description: Reference to an instance of __EventFilter that represents the object path to an event filter which is a query that specifies the type of event to be received.

columns.name: relative_path
columns.description: Relative path to the class or instance.

description: Lists the relationship between event consumers and filters.

name: wmi_script_event_consumers

columns.name: name
columns.description: Unique identifier for the event consumer.

columns.name: scripting_engine
columns.description: Name of the scripting engine to use, for example, 'VBScript'. This property cannot be NULL.

columns.name: script_file_name
columns.description: Name of the file from which the script text is read, intended as an alternative to specifying the text of the script in the ScriptText property.

columns.name: script_text
columns.description: Text of the script that is expressed in a language known to the scripting engine. This property must be NULL if the ScriptFileName property is not NULL.

columns.name: relative_path
columns.description: Relative path to the class or instance.

description: WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumer, which can be used for persistance on Windows. See https://www.blackhat.com/docs/us-15/materials/us-15-Graeber-Abusing-Windows-Management-Instrumentation-WMI-To-Build-A-Persistent%20Asynchronous-And-Fileless-Backdoor-wp.pdf for more details.

name: xprotect_entries

columns.name: filename
columns.description: Use this file name to match

columns.name: filetype
columns.description: Use this file type to match

columns.name: optional
columns.description: Match any of the identities/patterns for this XProtect name

columns.name: uses_pattern
columns.description: Uses a match pattern instead of identity

description: Database of the machine's XProtect signatures.

name: xprotect_meta
description: Database of the machine's XProtect browser-related signatures.

name: xprotect_reports

columns.name: user_action
columns.description: Action taken by user after prompted

description: Database of XProtect matches (if user generated/sent an XProtect report).

name: yara
description: Track YARA matches for files or PIDs.

name: yara_events
description: Track YARA matches for files specified in configuration data.
